text.__SUMMARY__: Common names: Hughes' carpet viper, Somali carpet viper, Hughes' saw-scaled viper.Echis hughesi is a species of venomous snake in the subfamily Viperinae of the family Viperidae. The species is endemic to Somalia. There are no subspecies which are currently recognized as being valid.
text.Etymology: The specific name, hughesi, is in honor of British herpetologist Barry Hughes.
text.Description: E. hughesi grows to a total length (including tail) of about 21–32 cm (8.3–12.6 in). The head scalation is similar to that of E. pyramidum. Midbody, there are 24-25 dorsal scale rows. The ventrals number 144-149, and the subcaudals number 28-30. The color pattern varies, but generally consists of a series of pale, oblique, dorsal blotches set against a darker ground color.
text.Geographic range:
E. hughesi is found only in northern Somalia, in northern Migiurtinia, near Meledin.
The type locality is listed as "Somalia, 10°02' [N lat.], 49° [E long.]".Migiurtinia was the name of a region, or gobolka, in Somalia that is currently known as Bari and occupies about 70,000 km2 (27,000 sq mi) of the tip of the Horn of Africa.
